图像检索在搜索引擎中起着至关重要的作用。通常，他们的用户依靠图像或文本作为查询来检索所需的目标图像。然而，基于文本的检索有其局限性，因为使用文字准确描述目标图像可能具有挑战性。例如，当搜索时尚商品时，用户可能想要其特定属性（例如徽标的颜色或徽标本身）与他们在网站中找到的不同的商品。然而，在现有搜索引擎中搜索该商品并非易事，因为通过文本精确描述时尚商品可能具有挑战性。为了解决这个问题，<a href="https://arxiv.org/pdf/1812.07119.pdf">;组合图像检索</a>; (CIR) 基于组合图像和文本样本的查询来检索图像它提供了有关如何修改图像以适合预期检索目标的说明。因此，CIR 可以通过图像和文本的结合来精确检索目标图像。 </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <p>; 然而，CIR 方法需要大量标记数据，即 1) 查询图像、2) 描述和 3) 目标图像的三元组。收集此类标记数据的成本很高，并且根据这些数据训练的模型通常是针对特定用例量身定制的，这限制了它们泛化到不同数据集的能力。 </p>; <p>; 为了解决这些挑战，请参阅“<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2302.03084">;Pic2Word：将图片映射到单词以进行零样本合成图像检索</a>;” ，我们提出了一个称为零样本 CIR (ZS-CIR) 的任务。在ZS-CIR中，我们的目标是构建一个执行各种CIR任务的单一CIR模型，例如<a href="https://www.zheyuanliu.me/CIRR/">;对象组合，</a>; < a href="https://arxiv.org/pdf/1905.12794.pdf">;属性编辑</a>;，或域转换，无需标记的三元组数据。相反，我们建议使用大规模图像标题对和未标记图像来训练检索模型，这些图像比大规模监督 CIR 数据集更容易收集。为了鼓励可重复性并进一步推进这一领域的发展，我们还<a href="https://github.com/google-research/composed_image_retrieval">;发布代码</a>;。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; center;">;不同查询图像和文本描述的定性结果。</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;结论和未来工作</h2>; <p>; 在本文中，我们介绍了 Pic2Word，一种用于 ZS-CIR 将图片映射到文字的方法。我们建议将图像转换为单词标记，以仅使用图像标题数据集来实现 CIR 模型。通过各种实验，我们验证了训练模型在各种 CIR 任务上的有效性，表明在图像字幕数据集上进行训练可以构建强大的 CIR 模型。未来一个潜在的研究方向是利用标题数据来训练映射网络，尽管我们在目前的工作中仅使用图像数据。 </p>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; schema="http://www. blogger.com/atom/ns#" term="深度学习">;</category>;<category schema="http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#" term="差异隐私">;</category >;<category schema="http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#" term="安全与隐私">;</category>;<title type="text">;宣布首届机器遗忘挑战</stitle >;<content type="html">;<span class="byline-author">;发布者：Google 研究科学家 Fabian Pedregosa 和 Eleni Triantafillou</span>; <img src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/ img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEhnYgC13GY7TTT4dhlutperGlCU07bWBJJr3yICTpKX4kxu8Beso89UtRLslnKi7XhD3T2kzkjHvKLNfXG_hztQxmbDFLafmLscIDZKGzOqWbOUxcYWjTDYgudshWu7v-m NrbhlegtEj7I-9woJvwgtOSfi01nKsalbOiYZmP1YN2FnQw_dTwobwwQvSrsv/s900/Unlearning.png" style="显示：无；" />; <p>; 深度学习最近在一系列应用中取得了巨大进步，包括<a href="https://imagen.research.google/">;真实图像生成</a>;和<a href= “https://ai.googleblog.com/2023/06/retrieval-augmented-visual-language-pre.html">;令人印象深刻的检索系统</a>;到<a href="https://blog.google/technology /ai/bard-google-ai-search-updates/">;可以进行类人对话的语言模型</a>;。虽然这一进展非常令人兴奋，但深度神经网络模型的广泛使用需要谨慎：在 Google AI <a href="https://ai.google/responsibility/principles/">;原则</a>;的指导下，我们寻求通过了解和减轻潜在风险（例如不公平偏见的传播和放大以及保护用户隐私）来负责任地开发人工智能技术。 </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <p>; 完全消除请求删除的数据的影响具有挑战性，因为除了简单地将其从存储的数据库中删除之外，还需要删除该数据对其他工件（例如训练有素的机器学习模型）的影响。此外，最近的研究 [<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/1610.05820">;1</a>;、<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2112.03570">;2</ a>;] 表明，在某些情况下，可以使用 <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adversarial_machine_learning#Model_extraction 高精度地推断示例是否用于训练机器学习模型">;成员推理攻击</a>; (MIA)。这可能会引起隐私问题，因为这意味着即使从数据库中删除个人数据，仍然可以推断该个人的数据是否用于训练模型。 </p>; <p>; 鉴于上述情况，<em>;机器遗忘</em>;是机器学习的一个新兴子领域，旨在消除训练样本的特定子集（“遗忘集”）的影响模型。此外，理想的去学习算法将消除某些示例的影响，同时保持其他有益的属性，例如训练集其余部分的准确性以及对保留示例的泛化。生成这种未学习模型的一种直接方法是在调整后的训练集上重新训练模型，该训练集排除了遗忘集中的样本。然而，这并不总是一个可行的选择，因为重新训练深度模型的计算成本可能很高。理想的去学习算法会使用已经训练的模型作为起点，并有效地进行调整以消除所请求数据的影响。 </p>; <p>; 今天，我们很高兴地宣布，我们已经与众多学术和工业研究人员合作组织了<a href="https://unlearning-challenge.github.io/" >;首届机器遗忘挑战</a>;。比赛考虑了一个现实场景，在训练后，必须忘记训练图像的某个子集，以保护相关个人的隐私或权利。比赛将在 <a href="https://www.kaggle.com/">;Kaggle</a>; 上举办，提交的作品将根据遗忘质量和模型实用性自动评分。我们希望这次竞赛将有助于推进机器去学习的最先进水平，并鼓励开发高效、有效和合乎道德的去学习算法。 </p>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;机器取消学习应用</h2>; <p>; 机器取消学习除了保护用户隐私之外还有其他应用。例如，可以使用忘却来从训练模型中删除不准确或过时的信息（例如，由于标记错误或环境变化）或删除有害的、被操纵的或异常值的数据。 </p>; <p>; 机器取消学习领域与机器学习的其他领域相关，例如<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Differential_privacy">;差分隐私</a>;、< a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/1802.07569">;终身学习</a>;，以及<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fairness_(machine_learning)">;公平</a>;。差分隐私旨在保证特定的训练样本不会对训练后的模型产生过大的影响；与忘却相比，这是一个更强大的目标，忘却只需要消除指定遗忘集的影响。终身学习研究旨在设计能够持续学习同时保持先前获得的技能的模型。随着消除学习工作的进展，它还可能开辟其他方法来提高模型的公平性，通过纠正不公平的偏见或对属于不同群体（例如人口统计、年龄组等）的成员的不同待遇。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>; <tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEiRnut8P03hlk5tKJPEEsqUl1DSlqN2ScdJeiaRfC3mWbQ_PBBwf7wBU9xgxuzr1GoqgkB6MwCa6Zrdo6LQxSOIPX IUrl1Yug73k2Q2zFI61VDAi9K21JOPox0Hc1CIh6ShKxW9Tgy45TYV3p3r5IiI7yxzzzOpzvbJ-5o3QVtjZn6vhDZLntnCcUSi1mb_/s720/image1.png" imageanchor=" 1" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="405" data-original-width="720" src="https:// /blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEiRnut8P03hlk5tKJPEEsqUl1DSlqN2ScdJeiaRfC3mWbQ_PBBwf7wBU9xgxuzr1GoqgkB6MwCa6Zrdo6LQxSOIPXIUrl1Yug73k2Q2zFI61VDAi9K 21JOPox0Hc1CIh6ShKxW9Tgy45TYV3p3r5IiI7yxzzzOpzvbJ-5o3QVtjZn6vhDZLntnCcUSi1mb_/s16000/image1.png"/>;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption"样式="text-align: center;">;<b>;遗忘的剖析。</b>;遗忘算法将预训练的模型和要遗忘的训练集中的一个或多个样本（“遗忘集”）作为输入。根据模型、遗忘集和保留集，忘却算法会生成更新的模型。理想的忘却算法生成的模型与没有遗忘集的训练模型没有区别。</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; < br>; </div>; <h2>;机器遗忘的挑战</h2>; <p>; 遗忘的问题是复杂且多方面的，因为它涉及几个相互冲突的目标：忘记所请求的数据、维持模型的效用（例如，保留的准确性）和保留的数据）和效率。因此，现有的去学习算法会做出不同的权衡。例如，完全再训练在不损害模型效用的情况下实现了成功的遗忘，但效率较低，而<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2007.02923">;向权重添加噪声</a>;则在公用事业费用。 </p>; <p>; 此外，迄今为止文献中对遗忘算法的评价高度不一致。虽然一些<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/1911.04933">;作品</a>;报告了要遗忘的样本的分类准确性，<a href="https://proceedings.mlr.press/ v119/wu20b.html">;其他</a>;报告与完全重新训练的模型的距离，还有其他人使用成员推理攻击的错误率作为忘记质量的指标[<a href="https://arxiv.org /abs/2302.09880">;4</a>;，<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2010.10981">;5</a>;，<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs /2005.02205">;6</a>;]。 </p>; <p>; 我们认为，评估指标的不一致和缺乏标准化协议是该领域进展的严重障碍——我们无法对文献中不同的遗忘方法进行直接比较。这让我们对不同方法的相对优点和缺点以及开发改进算法所面临的挑战和机遇抱有短视的看法。为了解决评估不一致的问题并推进机器遗忘领域的最新技术，我们与众多学术和工业研究人员合作组织了首个遗忘挑战。 </p>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;宣布首届机器忘却挑战</h2>; <p>; 我们很高兴地宣布<a href ="https://unlearning-challenge.github.io/">;首届机器学习挑战</a>;，该挑战将作为<a href="https://neurips.cc/Conferences/2023/的一部分举行CompetitionTrack">;NeurIPS 2023 竞赛赛道。</a>; 竞赛的目标是双重的。首先，通过统一和标准化遗忘的评估指标，我们希望通过同类比较来识别不同算法的优缺点。其次，通过向所有人开放本次竞赛，我们希望培育出新颖的解决方案，并揭示开放的挑战和机遇。 </p>; <p>; 比赛将在 <a href="https://www.kaggle.com/">;Kaggle</a>; 上举办，并于 2023 年 7 月中旬至 2023 年 9 月中旬举行。为了迎接比赛，今天我们宣布推出<a href="https://github.com/unlearning-challenge/starting-kit">;入门套件</a>;。该入门套件为参与者在玩具数据集上构建和测试他们的忘却模型提供了基础。 </p>; <p>; 比赛考虑了一个现实场景，其中年龄预测器已经接受了人脸图像的训练，训练后，必须忘记训练图像的某个子集，以保护相关个人的隐私或权利。为此，我们将提供合成面部数据集（示例如下所示）作为起始套件的一部分，并且我们还将使用几个真实面部数据集来评估提交的内容。参与者被要求提交代码，该代码将经过训练的预测器、遗忘集和保留集作为输入，并输出已忘记指定遗忘集的预测器的权重。我们将根据遗忘算法的强度和模型效用来评估提交的内容。我们还将强制执行硬截止，拒绝运行速度比重新训练时间的一小部分慢的遗忘算法。本次竞赛的一个有价值的成果将是描述不同不学习算法的权衡。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>; <tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEijGdpNGKrQ9AskeRnXVSjPcFrjFPWs5TvXIAeD0gkJVL0hizxuJ4LL24rdKuNPUr86ivbaJZ5x-3dHBBQzLTbFYUWQ 9p3ER5THVgv6xpOvK45_67ueGCtJsJVHrlkBKSfbz-21PrI2nkNGmoPcOkO_rqjR9W1-eDTxcjM6NNqqJkxMXMpRym_SYt3v6Wwn/s2000/image2.png “ imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="400" data-original-width="2000" src= “https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEijGdpNGKrQ9AskeRnXVSjPcFrjFPWs5TvXIAeD0gkJVL0hizxuJ4LL24rdKuNPUr86ivbaJZ5x-3dHBBQzLTbFYUWQ9p3ER5THVgv6xpOvK45_ 67ueGCtJsJVHrlkBKSfbz-21PrI2nkNGmoPcOkO_rqjR9W1-eDTxcjM6NNqqJkxMXMpRym_SYt3v6Wwn/s16000/image2.png"/>;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;摘自<a href="https://github.com/microsoft/FaceSynthetics">;人脸合成</a>;数据集的图像以及年龄注释。比赛考虑这样的场景：年龄预测器已经在上述人脸图像上进行了训练，并且在训练之后，必须忘记训练图像的某个子集。</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</ table>; <p>; 为了评估遗忘，我们将使用受 MIA 启发的工具，例如 <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2112.03570">;LiRA</a>;。 MIA 最初是在隐私和安全文献中开发的，其目标是推断哪些示例是训练集的一部分。直观上，如果遗忘成功，则未学习的模型不包含被遗忘示例的痕迹，从而导致 MIA 失败：攻击者将<em>;无法</em>;推断出遗忘集实际上是原始集的一部分训练集。此外，我们还将使用统计测试来量化未学习模型（由特定提交的未学习算法生成）的分布与从头开始重新训练的模型的分布有何不同。对于理想的去学习算法来说，这两者是无法区分的。 </p>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;结论</h2>; <p>; 机器遗忘是一个强大的工具，有潜力解决一些开放性问题。机器学习中的问题。随着这一领域研究的继续，我们希望看到更高效、更有效、更负责任的新方法。我们很高兴有机会通过这次比赛来激发人们对该领域的兴趣，我们期待与社区分享我们的见解和发现。 </p>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;致谢</h2>; <p>; <em>;本文作者现已加入 style="display: none;" />; <p>; In recent years, <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2006.11239">;diffusion models</a>; have shown great success in text-to-image generation, achieving high image quality, improved inference performance, and expanding our creative inspiration.然而，有效控制生成仍然具有挑战性，特别是在难以用文本描述的情况下。 </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <p>; Today, we announce <a href="https://mediapipe.dev/">;MediaPipe</a>; diffusion plugins, which enable controllable text-to-image generation to be run on-device. Expanding upon our <a href="https://ai.googleblog.com/2023/06/speed-is-all-you-need-on-device.html">;prior work</a>; on GPU inference for on-device large generative models, we introduce new low-cost solutions for controllable text-to-image generation that can be plugged into existing diffusion models and their Low-Rank Adaptation (<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2106.09685">;LoRA</a>;) variants. </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgV7MOp8-3-FSJQpmuovwRm6gcc64-i3T4CW370aiey5MWHThNtr_IPedqYh0aJl9rbolgzGdV-eRf2EDlhpWZN759usJt0wbzD5Gvdhx_6yZU5x6TnunYdXBBgzovXaT0oWgWma81L49g9G8nW8sgHD95I-0_J23jkYQ4LBPYEfI2N1d8PIYsWJgFaLpY/s1080/image6.gif" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="780" data-original-width="1080" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgV7MOp8-3-FSJQpmuovwRm6gcc64-i3T4CW370aiey5MWHThNtr_IPedqYh0aJl9rbolgzGdV-eRf2EDlhpWZN759usJt0wbzD5Gvdhx_6yZU5x6TnunYdXBBgzovXaT0oWgWma81L49g9G8nW8sgHD95I-0_J23jkYQ4LBPYEfI2N1d8PIYsWJgFaLpY/s16000/image6.gif" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;Text-to-image generation with control plugins running on-device.</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <br />; <h2>;Background</h2>; <p>; With diffusion models, image generation is modeled as an iterative denoising process. Starting from a noise image, at each step, the diffusion model gradually denoises the image to reveal an image of the target concept. Research shows that leveraging language understanding via text prompts can greatly improve image generation. For text-to-image generation, the text embedding is connected to the model via cross-attention layers. Yet, some information is difficult to describe by text prompts, eg, the position and pose of an object. To address this problem, researchers add additional models into the diffusion to inject control information from a condition image. </p>; <p>; Common approaches for controlled text-to-image generation include <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2211.12572">;Plug-and-Play</a>;, <a href="https://github.com/lllyasviel/ControlNet">;ControlNet</a>;, and <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2302.08453">;T2I Adapter</a>;. Plug-and-Play applies a widely used denoising diffusion implicit model (<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2010.02502">;DDIM</a>;) inversion approach that reverses the generation process starting from an input image to derive an initial noise input, and then employs a copy of the diffusion model (860M parameters for Stable Diffusion 1.5) to encode the condition from an input image. Plug-and-Play extracts spatial features with <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/1706.03762">;self-attention</a>; from the copied diffusion, and injects them into the text-to-image diffusion. ControlNet creates a trainable copy of the encoder of a diffusion model, which connects via a convolution layer with zero-initialized parameters to encode conditioning information that is conveyed to the decoder layers. However, as a result, the size is large, half that of the diffusion model (430M parameters for Stable Diffusion 1.5). T2I Adapter is a smaller network (77M parameters) and achieves similar effects in controllable generation. T2I Adapter only takes the condition image as input, and its output is shared across all diffusion iterations. Yet, the adapter model is not designed for portable devices. </p>; <br />; <h2>;The MediaPipe diffusion plugins</h2>; <p>; To make conditioned generation efficient, customizable, and scalable, we design the MediaPipe diffusion plugin as a separate network that is: </p>; <ul>; <li>;<i>;Plugable</i>;: It can be easily connected to a pre-trained base model. </li>;<li>;<i>;Trained from scratch</i>;: It does not use pre-trained weights from the base model. </li>;<li>;<i>;Portable</i>;: It runs outside the base model on mobile devices, with negligible cost compared to the base model inference. </li>; <p>; The MediaPipe diffusion plugin is a portable on-device model for text-to-image generation. It extracts multiscale features from a conditioning image, which are added to the encoder of a diffusion model at corresponding levels. When connecting to a text-to-image diffusion model, the plugin model can provide an extra conditioning signal to the image generation. We design the plugin network to be a lightweight model with only 6M parameters. It uses depth-wise convolutions and inverted bottlenecks from <a href="https://ai.googleblog.com/2018/04/mobilenetv2-next-generation-of-on.html">;MobileNetv2</a>; for fast inference on mobile devices. </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjunHsjDk5nhV0Ihky8QlPL-GWyr-vx6M-DYs36lK63AxxT_QZZrt4HNBmirqc_hY29OqzRxvMMVERk-kPpsFzfkpgTLExoq1TtliirmvH_lGp1dOYcKXIzgezB4Vgjj7XVVWHagFeZ3GBPNVrhZJuVl2z-p8prz5ex4jGQYqxOKwzbkoOk0lxTYmxZLg4/s1724/image1.png" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="628" data-original-width="1724" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjunHsjDk5nhV0Ihky8QlPL-GWyr-vx6M-DYs36lK63AxxT_QZZrt4HNBmirqc_hY29OqzRxvMMVERk-kPpsFzfkpgTLExoq1TtliirmvH_lGp1dOYcKXIzgezB4Vgjj7XVVWHagFeZ3GBPNVrhZJuVl2z-p8prz5ex4jGQYqxOKwzbkoOk0lxTYmxZLg4/s16000/image1.png" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;Overview of the MediaPipe diffusion model plugin. It injects features extracted from a condition image to a diffusion model, and consequently controls the image generation. Portable plugins can be connected to pre-trained diffusion models running on servers or devices. By running text-to-image generation and plugins fully on-device, we enable more flexible applications of generative AI. </p>; <br />; <h2>;Acknowledgments</h2>; <p>; <em>;We'd like to thank all team members who contributed to this work: Raman Sarokin and Juhyun Lee for the GPU inference solution; Khanh LeViet, Chuo-Ling Chang, Andrei Kulik, and Matthias Grundmann for leadership. Special thanks to Jiuqiang Tang</em>;<i>;, Joe Zou and Lu wang,</i>;<em>; who made this technology and all the demos running on-device.</em>;</p>;</content>;<link type="text">;Unifying image-caption and image-classification datasets with prefix conditioning</stitle>;<content type="html">;<span class="byline-author">;Posted by Kuniaki Saito, Student Researcher, Cloud AI Team, and Kihyuk Sohn, Research Scientist, Perception Team</span>; <img src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEhy_hT7xaiysVeAL6MKhQiqMfun0uCX1GJX9atNr8QSg4BlXfPPxNtC7AD21LJ0FSHjSnZnrKgttj1kIkmQGPyO4ORWvPSROjxfTvV9IlaTG5ZJom9oKEwwocUGaj3EtiuUgEmKKLHpWpQCrmHe3BzJeDGzwvI1Oqet18qsCNzIc3DsNTCXWGjZ0uMW9-Bc/s320/Prefix%20conditioning%20hero.jpg" style="display: none;" />; <p>; Pre-training visual language (VL) models on web-scale image-caption datasets has recently emerged as a powerful alternative to traditional pre-training on image classification data. Image-caption datasets are considered to be more “open-domain” because they contain broader scene types and vocabulary words, which result in models with <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2204.03610">;strong performance in few- and zero-shot recognition tasks</a>;.然而，具有细粒度类描述的图像可能很少见，并且由于图像标题数据集不经过手动管理，类分布可能不平衡。 By contrast, large-scale classification datasets, such as <a href="https://www.image-net.org/">;ImageNet</a>;, are often curated and can thus provide fine-grained categories with a balanced label distribution.虽然听起来很有希望，但直接结合标题和分类数据集进行预训练通常是不成功的，因为它可能会导致有偏差的表示，而这些表示不能很好地推广到各种下游任务。 </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <p>; In “<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2206.01125">;Prefix Conditioning Unifies Language and Label Supervision</a>;”, presented at <a href="https://cvpr2023.thecvf.com/">;CVPR 2023</a>;, we demonstrate a pre-training strategy that uses both classification and caption datasets to provide complementary benefits.首先，我们表明，天真地统一数据集会导致下游零样本识别任务的性能次优，因为模型受到数据集偏差的影响：每个数据集中图像域和词汇的覆盖范围不同。 We address this problem during training through <em>;prefix conditioning</em>;, a novel simple and effective method that uses prefix tokens to disentangle dataset biases from visual concepts.这种方法允许语言编码器从两个数据集学习，同时还为每个数据集定制特征提取。 Prefix conditioning is a generic method that can be easily integrated into existing VL pre-training objectives, such as <a href="https://openai.com/research/clip">;Contrastive Language-Image Pre-training</a>; (CLIP) or <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2204.03610">;Unified Contrastive Learning</a>; (UniCL). </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;High-level idea</h2>; <p>; We note that classification datasets tend to be biased in at least two ways: (1) the images mostly contain single objects from restricted domains, and (2) the vocabulary is limited and lacks the linguistic flexibility required for zero-shot learning.例如，针对 ImageNet 优化的“狗的照片”的类嵌入通常会导致从 ImageNet 数据集拉取的图像中心有一张狗的照片，这不能很好地推广到包含多只狗的图像的其他数据集在不同的空间位置或狗与其他主体。 </p>; <p>; By contrast, caption datasets contain a wider variety of scene types and vocabularies.如下所示，如果模型只是从两个数据集学习，则语言嵌入可能会纠缠图像分类和标题数据集的偏差，这会降低零样本分类的泛化能力。如果我们能够消除两个数据集的偏差，我们就可以使用为标题数据集量身定制的语言嵌入来提高泛化能力。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEhAH8qOwZZQO32vlcA-QsPrbO6gmSrIK7LPqzJctsfYswtrhxccx-plypSfvij0_7hlbBiy3isvb526YbqifUcnvjdP4LVtk8HAETdWgEFqgaDX_O4BJi91dJFvwshi_KEjBJ8l1HySYtP73xMUlqL-TiB9KifhVSfe8563Z00olE8-JAiHHXuesWu5tgDg/s1150/image1.png" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="1150" data-original-width="856" height="640" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEhAH8qOwZZQO32vlcA-QsPrbO6gmSrIK7LPqzJctsfYswtrhxccx-plypSfvij0_7hlbBiy3isvb526YbqifUcnvjdP4LVtk8HAETdWgEFqgaDX_O4BJi91dJFvwshi_KEjBJ8l1HySYtP73xMUlqL-TiB9KifhVSfe8563Z00olE8-JAiHHXuesWu5tgDg/w476-h640/image1.png" width="476" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;<strong>;Top</strong>;: Language embedding entangling the bias from image classification and caption dataset. <strong>;Bottom</strong>;: Language embeddings disentangles the bias from two datasets.</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <br />; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;Prefix conditioning</h2>; <p>; Prefix conditioning is partially inspired by <a href="https://ai.googleblog.com/2022/02/guiding-frozen-language-models-with.html">;prompt tuning</a>;, which prepends learnable tokens to the input token sequences to instruct a pre-trained model backbone to learn task-specific knowledge that can be used to solve downstream tasks.前缀调节方法与提示调整有两个不同之处：（1）它旨在通过消除数据集偏差来统一图像标题和分类数据集，（2）它应用于 VL 预训练，而标准提示调整是用于微调模型。前缀条件是一种显式方法，可根据用户提供的数据集类型专门引导模型主干的行为。当提前知道不同类型数据集的数量时，这在生产中特别有用。 </p>; <p>; During training, prefix conditioning learns a text token (prefix token) for each dataset type, which absorbs the bias of the dataset and allows the remaining text tokens to focus on learning visual concepts.具体来说，它将每个数据集类型的前缀标记添加到输入标记中，以通知输入数据类型的语言和视觉编码器（例如，分类与标题）。前缀标记经过训练可以学习数据集类型特定的偏差，这使我们能够消除语言表示中的偏差，并在测试期间利用在图像标题数据集上学习到的嵌入，即使没有输入标题。 </p>; <p>; We utilize prefix conditioning for CLIP using a language and visual encoder.在测试期间，我们采用用于图像标题数据集的前缀，因为该数据集应该涵盖更广泛的场景类型和词汇，从而在零样本识别中获得更好的性能。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEhuU4-e7aPX98_nWDVCyecgsHcnXAK2ATQOLyUrZs4aXHK5tH6Au661b_LKrkqhnsk4JweQy7BdkguHFjelarx3Me5cwJ59Vf0sBv4TbPSNIpLc8k7Xg1fzc5Ud69ltx8uYU5iSZXq1vzk1S0vUJpcnQF72KkEmyv4LdHCUG9NK9qv0UK2kxy81XBupZjq_/s1038/image5.png" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="436" data-original-width="1038" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEhuU4-e7aPX98_nWDVCyecgsHcnXAK2ATQOLyUrZs4aXHK5tH6Au661b_LKrkqhnsk4JweQy7BdkguHFjelarx3Me5cwJ59Vf0sBv4TbPSNIpLc8k7Xg1fzc5Ud69ltx8uYU5iSZXq1vzk1S0vUJpcnQF72KkEmyv4LdHCUG9NK9qv0UK2kxy81XBupZjq_/s16000/image5.png" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;Illustration of the Prefix Conditioning.</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <br />; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;Experimental results</h2>; <p>; We apply prefix conditioning to two types of contrastive loss, <a href="http://proceedings.mlr.press/v139/radford21a">;CLIP</a>; and <a href="https://openaccess.thecvf.com/content/CVPR2022/papers/Yang_Unified_Contrastive_Learning_in_Image-Text-Label_Space_CVPR_2022_paper.pdf">;UniCL,</a>; and evaluate their performance on zero-shot recognition tasks compared to models trained with <a href="https://www.image-net.org/">;ImageNet21K</a>; (IN21K) and <a href="https://github.com/google-research-datasets/conceptual-12m">;Conceptual 12M</a>; (CC12M).使用前缀调节使用两个数据集训练的 CLIP 和 UniCL 模型显示出零样本分类精度的巨大改进。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgG2Q3QfWGfGILVqZwtavflFt7cRHOAk31wFR0qP75W8tgDZjGTa3SleAayInpJAj1JUPjX6kM2b9T49svL_hpMCQVfbgPSkpEIBDDLV2hOA5JNnxy23o6mkN2flXaYyykEmBLWNXFGWqHlKvmWyuGaHR-nmqVgUDpdXJFqv_LWYfxWLuFxAijhK9QMVUeS/s440/image4.png" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="339" data-original-width="440" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgG2Q3QfWGfGILVqZwtavflFt7cRHOAk31wFR0qP75W8tgDZjGTa3SleAayInpJAj1JUPjX6kM2b9T49svL_hpMCQVfbgPSkpEIBDDLV2hOA5JNnxy23o6mkN2flXaYyykEmBLWNXFGWqHlKvmWyuGaHR-nmqVgUDpdXJFqv_LWYfxWLuFxAijhK9QMVUeS/s16000/image4.png" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;Zero-shot classification accuracy of models trained with only IN21K or CC12M compared to CLIP and UniCL models trained with both two datasets using prefix conditioning (“Ours”). </td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <br />; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h3>;Study on test-time prefix</h3>; <p>; The table below describes the performance change by the prefix used during test time. We demonstrate that by using the same prefix used for the classification dataset (“Prompt”), the performance on the classification dataset (<a href="https://www.image-net.org/">;IN-1K</a>;) improves.当使用与图像标题数据集（“Caption”）相同的前缀时，其他数据集（零样本 AVG）的性能会提高。该分析表明，如果前缀是针对图像标题数据集定制的，则可以更好地泛化场景类型和词汇。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEiEKR_NiDSFulAI_WNnugarKESL4Fn3XiOAkpxXgnfhwseeUmJEdXYDiMmit-fzeucV1J_zHyI7vuWF2fMAX6TuEjo7dhe9wMNMId_GhLHNu8NuxGsRihvJgp-IEt8AIPVhm-s3LxAiagKoXx5M5m4_dQysTUBD5928Vz9y616ZWjg7k93dU673ze7yPVJV/s1200/image2.png" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="742" data-original-width="1200" height="396" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEiEKR_NiDSFulAI_WNnugarKESL4Fn3XiOAkpxXgnfhwseeUmJEdXYDiMmit-fzeucV1J_zHyI7vuWF2fMAX6TuEjo7dhe9wMNMId_GhLHNu8NuxGsRihvJgp-IEt8AIPVhm-s3LxAiagKoXx5M5m4_dQysTUBD5928Vz9y616ZWjg7k93dU673ze7yPVJV/w640-h396/image2.png" width="640" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;Analysis of the prefix used for test-time. </td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <br />; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h3>;Study on robustness to image distribution shift </h3>; <p>; We study the shift in image distribution using ImageNet variants. We see that the “Caption” prefix performs better than “Prompt” in <a href="https://github.com/hendrycks/imagenet-r">;ImageNet-R</a>; (IN-R) and <a href="https://github.com/HaohanWang/ImageNet-Sketch">;ImageNet-Sketch</a>; (IN-S), but underperforms in <a href="https://github.com/modestyachts/ImageNetV2">;ImageNet-V2</a>; (IN-V2).这表明“Caption”前缀实现了远离分类数据集的领域的泛化。因此，最佳前缀可能因测试域距分类数据集的距离而异。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEhfTb-mZqtDI06KnEyrbU32FzIPStwextAYMUk5CnhS89pPMrU14TH7_nzN-lzPw11KM4FrDpXC4KVybxgVUvsT-dEt7xJ0SrqOFQM_LFvELjhiBVMYiePAdpt337_9pBZV9EWQg2zPUaxksQglNNCkgFI66X6c1-Ws1CkRGN9Bu9zrni_U-THju4E5MUxN/s1200/image3.png" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="742" data-original-width="1200" height="396" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEhfTb-mZqtDI06KnEyrbU32FzIPStwextAYMUk5CnhS89pPMrU14TH7_nzN-lzPw11KM4FrDpXC4KVybxgVUvsT-dEt7xJ0SrqOFQM_LFvELjhiBVMYiePAdpt337_9pBZV9EWQg2zPUaxksQglNNCkgFI66X6c1-Ws1CkRGN9Bu9zrni_U-THju4E5MUxN/w640-h396/image3.png" width="640" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;Analysis on the robustness to image-level distribution shift. IN：ImageNet，IN-V2：ImageNet-V2，IN-R：艺术，卡通风格 ImageNet，IN-S：ImageNet 草图。 </td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <br />; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;Conclusion and future work</h2>; <p>; We introduce prefix conditioning, a technique for unifying image caption and classification datasets for better zero-shot classification.我们证明这种方法可以带来更好的零样本分类精度，并且前缀可以控制语言嵌入中的偏差。一个限制是在标题数据集上学习的前缀不一定对于零样本分类来说是最佳的。确定每个测试数据集的最佳前缀是未来工作的一个有趣方向。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;Acknowledgements</h2>; <p>; <em>;This research was conducted by Kuniaki Saito, Kihyuk Sohn, Xiang Zhang, Chun-Liang Li, Chen-Yu Lee, Kate Saenko, and Tomas Pfister. scheme="http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#" term="Systems">;</category>;<title type="text">;Preference learning with automated feedback for cache eviction</stitle>;<content type="html">;<span class="byline-author">;Posted by Ramki Gummadi, Software Engineer, Google and Kevin Chen, Software Engineer, YouTube</span>; <img src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjvw85_8jzAL-q7CGVpJ-qtMLcu0Zmi6d831BAsHj-33Mw6dF6SphPpL5Bhx13fAzZFtayquwlGdwhSLIvcktVm5Iu48JpNCNBueEbu-tJrs5tlJD5eS2qV0DeCdR0z9ppfVNFafEc3B-CcXg68mhybf2z458qG9hjTGtHPQ4tLOCF15GRcL4uiHTu5vIvL/s320/Halp%20hero%20gif.gif" style="display: none;" />; <p>; Caching is a ubiquitous idea in computer science that significantly improves the performance of storage and retrieval systems by storing a subset of popular items closer to the client based on request patterns. An important algorithmic piece of cache management is the decision policy used for dynamically updating the set of items being stored, which has been extensively optimized over several decades, resulting in several <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cache_replacement_policies">;efficient and robust heuristics</a>;. While applying machine learning to cache policies has shown promising results in recent years (eg, <a href="https://www.usenix.org/conference/nsdi20/presentation/song">;LRB</a>;, <a href="https://www.usenix.org/system/files/conference/nsdi18/nsdi18-beckmann.pdf">;LHD</a>;, <a href="https://www.pdl.cmu.edu/PDL-FTP/Storage/MLSys2021-zhou.pdf">;storage applications</a>;), it remains a challenge to outperform robust heuristics in a way that can generalize reliably beyond benchmarks to production settings, while maintaining competitive compute and memory overheads. </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <p>; In “<a href="https://storage.googleapis.com/pub-tools-public-publication-data/pdf/c9ebaf640152028a6cdedb684577a7c9e52b6f10.pdf">;HALP: Heuristic Aided Learned Preference Eviction Policy for YouTube Content Delivery Network</a>;”, presented at <a href="https://www.usenix.org/conference/nsdi23">;NSDI 2023</a>;, we introduce a scalable state-of-the-art cache eviction framework that is based on learned rewards and uses <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Preference_learning">;preference learning</a>; with automated feedback.启发式辅助学习偏好 (HALP) 框架是一种元算法，它使用随机化将轻量级启发式基线驱逐规则与学习奖励模型合并。 The reward model is a lightweight neural network that is continuously trained with ongoing automated feedback on preference comparisons designed to mimic the <a href="https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S0020019006003449">;offline oracle</a>;. We discuss how HALP has improved infrastructure efficiency and user video playback latency for YouTube's <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Content_delivery_network">;content delivery network</a>;. </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;Learned preferences for cache eviction decisions</h2>; <p>; The HALP framework computes cache eviction decisions based on two components: (1) a neural reward model trained with automated feedback via preference learning, and (2) a meta-algorithm that combines a learned reward model with a fast heuristic. As the cache observes incoming requests, HALP continuously trains a small neural network that predicts a scalar reward for each item by formulating this as a preference learning method via <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Learning_to_rank#Pairwise_approach">;pairwise</a>; preference feedback. This aspect of HALP is similar to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reinforcement_learning_from_human_feedback">;reinforcement learning from human feedback</a>; (RLHF) systems, but with two important distinctions: </p>; <ul>; <li>;Feedback is <em>;automated</em>; and leverages well-known results about the structure of offline <a href="https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S0020019006003449">;optimal</a>; cache eviction policies. </li>;<li>;The model is <em>;learned continuously</em>; using a transient buffer of training examples constructed from the automated feedback process. </li>; </ul>; <p>; The eviction decisions rely on a filtering mechanism with two steps.首先，使用高效但性能欠佳的启发式方法选择一小部分候选者。然后，重新排序步骤通过少量使用神经网络评分函数从基线候选中进行优化，以“提高”最终决策的质量。 </p>; <p>; As a production ready cache policy implementation, HALP not only makes eviction decisions, but also subsumes the end-to-end process of sampling pairwise preference queries used to efficiently construct relevant feedback and update the model to power eviction decisions. </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;A neural reward model</h2>; <p>; HALP uses a light-weight two-layer <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multilayer_perceptron">;multilayer perceptron</a>; (MLP) as its reward model to selectively score individual items in the cache. The features are constructed and managed as a metadata-only “ghost cache” (similar to classical policies like <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adaptive_replacement_cache">;ARC</a>;).在任何给定的查找请求之后，除了常规的缓存操作之外，HALP 还会进行更新动态内部表示所需的簿记（例如，跟踪和更新容量受限的键值存储中的特征元数据）。这包括：（1）由用户作为输入提供的外部标记特征以及缓存查找请求，以及（2）根据观察到的查找时间构建的内部构造的动态特征（例如，自上次访问以来的时间、访问之间的平均时间）每一个项目。 </p>; <p>; HALP learns its reward model fully online starting from a random weight initialization.这似乎是一个坏主意，特别是如果决策专门用于优化奖励模型的话。 However, the eviction decisions rely on both the learned reward model and a suboptimal but simple and robust heuristic like <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cache_replacement_policies#LRU">;LRU</a>;.当奖励模型完全泛化时，这可以实现最佳性能，同时对尚未泛化的暂时无信息的奖励模型或在赶上不断变化的环境的过程中保持鲁棒性。 </p>; <p>; Another advantage of online training is specialization.每个缓存服务器都在可能不同的环境（例如地理位置）中运行，这会影响本地网络条件以及本地流行的内容等。 Online training automatically captures this information while reducing the burden of generalization, as opposed to a single offline training solution.</p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;Scoring samples from a randomized priority queue </h2>; <p>; It can be impractical to optimize for the quality of eviction decisions with an exclusively learned objective for two reasons. </p>; <ol>; <li>;Compute efficiency constraints: Inference with a learned network can be significantly more expensive than the computations performed in practical cache policies operating at scale.这不仅限制了网络和功能的表达能力，还限制了每次驱逐决策期间调用这些功能的频率。 </li>;<li>;Robustness for generalizing out-of-distribution: HALP is deployed in a setup that involves continual learning, where a quickly changing workload might generate request patterns that might be temporarily out-of-distribution with respect to previously seen data. </li>; </ol>; <p>; To address these issues, HALP first applies an inexpensive heuristic scoring rule that corresponds to an eviction priority to identify a small candidate sample. This process is based on efficient random sampling that <a href="http://web.stanford.edu/~balaji/papers/01arandomized.pdf">;approximates</a>; exact <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Priority_queue">;priority queues</a>;.用于生成候选样本的优先级函数旨在使用现有的手动调整算法（例如LRU）快速计算。然而，这可以通过编辑简单的成本函数来配置以近似其他缓存替换启发式。 Unlike <a href="http://web.stanford.edu/~balaji/papers/01arandomized.pdf">;prior work</a>;, where the randomization was used to tradeoff approximation for efficiency, HALP also <em>;relies</em>; on the inherent randomization in the sampled candidates across time steps for providing the necessary <a href="https://lilianweng.github.io/posts/2020-06-07-exploration-drl/">;exploratory</a>; diversity in the sampled candidates for both training and inference. </p>; <p>; The final evicted item is chosen from among the supplied candidates, equivalent to the <a href="https://openai.com/research/measuring-goodharts-law">;best-of-n</a>; reranked sample, corresponding to maximizing the predicted<em>; </em>;preference score according to the neural reward model.用于驱逐决策的同一候选池也用于构建自动反馈的成对偏好查询，这有助于最大限度地减少样本之间的训练和推理偏差。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgRd1ot8suIGs_IQQrywOjbrF8HfHevcQQX3x2GEJjJ3nI4NmPPCs346mSFAYLIzfUWPD2tvfLyvdY2divzEEvfAA7aieN2cZjyMIm7_MVPockLfhOAvIp7HEiF60FSFv3zJx7iWd_7koIClmh6-JYB839Giekw6y0DYcafH2DezknagObjsM6FY8cpwE3_/s1470/Halp.gif" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="523" data-original-width="1470" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgRd1ot8suIGs_IQQrywOjbrF8HfHevcQQX3x2GEJjJ3nI4NmPPCs346mSFAYLIzfUWPD2tvfLyvdY2divzEEvfAA7aieN2cZjyMIm7_MVPockLfhOAvIp7HEiF60FSFv3zJx7iWd_7koIClmh6-JYB839Giekw6y0DYcafH2DezknagObjsM6FY8cpwE3_/s16000/Halp.gif" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;An overview of the two-stage process invoked for each eviction decision.</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <br />; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;Online preference learning with automated feedback</h2>; <p>; The reward model is learned using online feedback, which is based on automatically assigned preference labels that indicate, wherever feasible, the ranked preference ordering for the time taken to receive future re-accesses, starting from a given snapshot in time among each queried sample of items.这类似于预言机的最优策略，在任何给定时间，从缓存中的所有项目中驱逐具有最远未来访问权的项目。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgHuAHFUePtnBtdnqKixxgxJwHQrkRWDJEyVJz3Eve60gvMgRLeWE2o1Ton1IaGFCUBvH6e0yhWkoLzm3JlTAuAZkhPRZacl2JnOoWU5AkEd8lFi2tNlbVHH-XSxwAmatRIVpBCAjdmFjh7kXgN1Lk2G2RYbkC8_Ods_RcHwB10yhkq_bNUjGfoX9JIjsn_/s1200/image2.gif" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="400" data-original-width="1200" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgHuAHFUePtnBtdnqKixxgxJwHQrkRWDJEyVJz3Eve60gvMgRLeWE2o1Ton1IaGFCUBvH6e0yhWkoLzm3JlTAuAZkhPRZacl2JnOoWU5AkEd8lFi2tNlbVHH-XSxwAmatRIVpBCAjdmFjh7kXgN1Lk2G2RYbkC8_Ods_RcHwB10yhkq_bNUjGfoX9JIjsn_/s16000/image2.gif" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;Generation of the automated feedback for learning the reward model.</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <br />; <p>; To make this feedback process informative, HALP constructs pairwise preference queries that are most likely to be relevant for eviction decisions. In sync with the usual cache operations, HALP issues a small number of pairwise preference queries while making each eviction decision, and appends them to a set of <em>;pending comparisons. </em>;The labels for these pending comparisons can only be resolved at a random future time.为了在线操作，HALP 还在每个查找请求之后执行一些额外的簿记，以处理可以在当前请求之后增量标记的任何待处理比较。 HALP 使用比较中涉及的每个元素对挂起的比较缓冲区进行索引，并回收过时的比较所消耗的内存（两者都无法重新访问），以确保与反馈生成相关的内存开销随着时间的推移保持有限。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEia9IxIR9ONuZtOcHejyvhWJEwEAPb1xwfTC5eY7WC829Px39Kb6IwVkQKWFqM98IlWUpbSP4Vh6oS89UV1sxOsECA8H4PvInlUTLeB7X5myDLUU_6AO5bBLRZeMqvOEjq5kCNLdS1AGd2lsS9i9fKanr8UsRASDKmCCoh7i-MQkuCcZuGrmgXDFmCBEHZu/s1468/image3.png" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="1032" data-original-width="1468" height="450" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEia9IxIR9ONuZtOcHejyvhWJEwEAPb1xwfTC5eY7WC829Px39Kb6IwVkQKWFqM98IlWUpbSP4Vh6oS89UV1sxOsECA8H4PvInlUTLeB7X5myDLUU_6AO5bBLRZeMqvOEjq5kCNLdS1AGd2lsS9i9fKanr8UsRASDKmCCoh7i-MQkuCcZuGrmgXDFmCBEHZu/w640-h450/image3.png" width="640" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;Overview of all main components in HALP.</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <br />; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;Results: Impact on the YouTube CDN</h2>; <p>; Through empirical analysis, we show that HALP compares favorably to state-of-the-art cache policies on public benchmark traces in terms of cache miss rates.然而，虽然公共基准是一个有用的工具，但它们很少足以捕获一段时间内世界各地的所有使用模式，更不用说我们已经部署的各种硬件配置了。 </p>; <p>; Until recently, YouTube servers used an optimized LRU-variant for memory cache eviction. HALP 将 YouTube 的内存出口/入口（CDN 提供的总带宽出口与由于缓存未命中而用于检索（入口）消耗的带宽之比）增加了大约 12%，内存命中率提高了 6%。这减少了用户的延迟，因为内存读取比磁盘读取更快，并且还通过屏蔽磁盘流量来提高磁盘限制机器的出口容量。 </p>; <p>; The figure below shows a visually compelling reduction in the <a href="https://www.usenix.org/legacy/publications/library/proceedings/usits97/full_papers/cao/cao_html/node12.html">;byte miss ratio</a>; in the days following HALP's final rollout on the YouTube CDN, which is now serving significantly more content from within the cache with lower latency to the end user, and without having to resort to more expensive retrieval that increases the operating costs. </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEijgxJi0LBqVUqJ-JB4tw4XTSile4uoCD2akELZ4pXNtdjV2eYf7uxQuIZk2YVnnEnnSHh2Snjx3G-BPGRy4T1Tl2wPMFShOcCQm8rfTRwa0CrNYhvDhrlX_U8RbeC3AlaF6Fg3qgLMw8xeQCPZwS-YnxloUjIw7oXZzYBfmqURlsFmg0o2gxe5r9d5CIyW/s505/image1.png" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="257" data-original-width="505" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEijgxJi0LBqVUqJ-JB4tw4XTSile4uoCD2akELZ4pXNtdjV2eYf7uxQuIZk2YVnnEnnSHh2Snjx3G-BPGRy4T1Tl2wPMFShOcCQm8rfTRwa0CrNYhvDhrlX_U8RbeC3AlaF6Fg3qgLMw8xeQCPZwS-YnxloUjIw7oXZzYBfmqURlsFmg0o2gxe5r9d5CIyW/s16000/image1.png" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;Aggregate worldwide YouTube byte miss ratio before and after rollout (vertical dashed line).</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <br />; <p>; An aggregated performance improvement could still hide important regressions.除了衡量总体影响之外，我们还在本文中进行了分析，以使用机器级分析来了解其对不同机架的影响，并发现其影响是极其积极的。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;Conclusion</h2>; <p>; We introduced a scalable state-of-the-art cache eviction framework that is based on learned rewards and uses <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Preference_learning">;preference learning</a>; with automated feedback.由于其设计选择，HALP 可以以类似于任何其他缓存策略的方式部署，而无需单独管理标记示例、训练过程和模型版本作为大多数机器学习系统常见的附加离线管道的操作开销。因此，与其他经典算法相比，它只产生很小的额外开销，但具有能够利用附加功能来做出驱逐决策并不断适应不断变化的访问模式的额外好处。 </p>; <p>; This is the first large-scale deployment of a learned cache policy to a widely used and heavily trafficked CDN, and has significantly improved the CDN infrastructure efficiency while also delivering a better quality of experience to users. </p>; style="display: none;" />; <p>; The recent progress in generative AI unlocked the possibility of creating new content in several different domains, including text, vision and audio.这些模型通常依赖于这样一个事实：原始数据首先转换为压缩格式作为令牌序列。 In the case of audio, neural audio codecs (eg, <a href="https://ai.googleblog.com/2021/08/soundstream-end-to-end-neural-audio.html">;SoundStream</a>; or <a href="https://github.com/facebookresearch/encodec">;EnCodec</a>;) can efficiently compress waveforms to a compact representation, which can be inverted to reconstruct an approximation of the original audio signal. Such a representation consists of a sequence of discrete audio tokens, capturing the local properties of sounds (eg, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phoneme">;phonemes</a>;) and their temporal structure (eg, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosody_(linguistics)">;prosody</a>;). By representing audio as a sequence of discrete tokens, audio generation can be performed with <a href="https://ai.googleblog.com/2017/08/transformer-novel-neural-network.html">;Transformer</a>;-based sequence-to-sequence models — this has unlocked rapid progress in speech continuation (eg, with <a href="https://ai.googleblog.com/2022/10/audiolm-language-modeling-approach-to.html">;AudioLM</a>;), text-to-speech (eg, with <a href="https://google-research.github.io/seanet/speartts/examples/">;SPEAR-TTS</a>;), and general audio and music generation (eg, <a href="https://felixkreuk.github.io/audiogen/">;AudioGen</a>; and <a href="https://google-research.github.io/seanet/musiclm/examples/">;MusicLM</a>;).许多生成音频模型，包括 AudioLM，都依赖于自动回归解码，它会一一生成令牌。虽然这种方法实现了高音质，但推理（即计算输出）可能很慢，尤其是在解码长序列时。 </p>;<a name='more'>;</a>; <p>; To address this issue, in “<a href="https://google-research.github.io/seanet/soundstorm/examples/">;SoundStorm: Efficient Parallel Audio Generation</a>;”, we propose a new method for efficient and high-quality audio generation. SoundStorm addresses the problem of generating long audio token sequences by relying on two novel elements: 1) an architecture adapted to the specific nature of audio tokens as produced by the SoundStream neural codec, and 2) a decoding scheme inspired by <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2202.04200">;MaskGIT</a>;, a recently proposed method for image generation, which is tailored to operate on audio tokens.与AudioLM的自回归解码方法相比，SoundStorm能够并行生成token，从而将长序列的推理时间减少100倍，并产生相同质量的音频，并且在语音和声学条件下具有更高的一致性。 Moreover, we show that SoundStorm, coupled with the text-to-semantic modeling stage of <a href="https://google-research.github.io/seanet/speartts/examples/">;SPEAR-TTS</a>;, can synthesize high-quality, natural dialogues, allowing one to control the spoken content (via transcripts), speaker voices (via short voice prompts) and speaker turns (via transcript annotations), as demonstrated by the examples below: </p>; <br>; <video controls="controls" playsinline="" style="margin-left: 10%; margin-right: 10%;" width="80%">; <source src="https://google-research.github.io/seanet/soundstorm/examples/data/SoundStorm_promo.mp4" type="video/mp4">;</source>; </video>; <br>; <br>; <br>; <table>; <tr>; <td>;<b>;Input: Text<em>; (transcript used to drive the audio generation in bold)</em>;</b>; </td>; <td>;      </td>; <td style="vertical-align: top">;<span style="font-size: small;">;<em>;Something really funny happened to me this morning. |哦，哇，什么？ | <b>;Well, uh I woke up as usual. |呃呃|下楼去吃早餐。 |是啊|开始吃饭了。然后呃 10 分钟后我意识到现在是半夜了。 | Oh no way, that's so funny!</b>;</em>;</span>; <br>; </div>; <h2>;SoundStorm design</h2>; <p>; In our previous work on AudioLM, we showed that audio generation can be decomposed into two steps: 1) semantic modeling, which generates semantic tokens from either previous semantic tokens or a conditioning signal (eg, a transcript as in SPEAR-TTS, or a text prompt as in MusicLM), and 2) acoustic modeling, which generates acoustic tokens from semantic tokens.通过 SoundStorm，我们专门解决了第二个声学建模步骤，用更快的并行解码取代了较慢的自回归解码。 </p>; <p>; SoundStorm relies on a bidirectional attention-based <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2005.08100">;Conformer</a>;, a model architecture that combines a Transformer with convolutions to capture both local and global structure of a sequence of tokens.具体来说，该模型经过训练，可以在给定 AudioLM 生成的语义标记序列作为输入的情况下预测 SoundStream 生成的音频标记。 When doing this, it is important to take into account the fact that, at each time step <em>;t</em>;, SoundStream uses up to <em>;Q</em>; tokens to represent the audio using a method known as <em>;residual vector quantization</em>; (RVQ), as illustrated below on the right. The key intuition is that the quality of the reconstructed audio progressively increases as the number of generated tokens at each step goes from 1 to <em>;Q</em>;. </p>; <p>; At inference time, given the semantic tokens as input conditioning signal, SoundStorm starts with all audio tokens masked out, and fills in the masked tokens over multiple iterations, starting from the coarse tokens at RVQ level <em>;q = 1</em>; and proceeding level-by-level with finer tokens until reaching level <em>;q = Q</em>;. </p>; <p>; There are two crucial aspects of SoundStorm that enable fast generation: 1) tokens are predicted in parallel during a single iteration within a RVQ level and, 2) the model architecture is designed in such a way that the complexity is only mildly affected by the number of levels <em>;Q</em>;.为了支持这种推理方案，在训练期间，使用精心设计的掩蔽方案来模拟推理中使用的迭代过程。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjI75okNCRdLNSwU31uccP6wuIXVDxhhhvTI9f_V0ntiAxUOtw29TZeAvNFZXNBta9GraHB1bikM6zGQrFM7zSt2d985P6OC9On0xDwrLfj9OzJjdJ8BjrcYiAj_VGi3VQsqCIbNx_B7DP75KCU9D6xB_ybgHDpBk0z-eBkXXRdu9u04zcdzNCKGJuqszrR/s1999/image2.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="951" data-original-width="1999" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjI75okNCRdLNSwU31uccP6wuIXVDxhhhvTI9f_V0ntiAxUOtw29TZeAvNFZXNBta9GraHB1bikM6zGQrFM7zSt2d985P6OC9On0xDwrLfj9OzJjdJ8BjrcYiAj_VGi3VQsqCIbNx_B7DP75KCU9D6xB_ybgHDpBk0z-eBkXXRdu9u04zcdzNCKGJuqszrR/s16000/image2.png" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;SoundStorm model architecture. <em>;T</em>; denotes the number of time steps and <em>;Q</em>; the number of RVQ levels used by SoundStream. The semantic tokens used as conditioning are time-aligned with the SoundStream frames.</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;Measuring SoundStorm performance</h2>; <p>; We demonstrate that SoundStorm matches the quality of AudioLM's acoustic generator, replacing both AudioLM's stage two (coarse acoustic model) and stage three (fine acoustic model).此外，SoundStorm 生成音频的速度比 AudioLM 的分层自回归声音发生器（下图上半部分）快 100 倍，并且在说话者身份和声学条件方面具有匹配的质量和更高的一致性（下图下半部分）。 </p>; The shaded area represents the inter-quartile range.</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;Safety and risk mitigation</h2>; <p>; We acknowledge that the audio samples produced by the model may be influenced by the unfair biases present in the training data, for instance in terms of represented accents and voice characteristics. In our generated samples, we demonstrate that we can reliably and responsibly control speaker characteristics via prompting, with the goal of avoiding unfair biases. A thorough analysis of any training data and its limitations is an area of future work in line with our responsible <a href="http://ai.google/principles">;AI Principles</a>;. </p>; <p>; In turn, the ability to mimic a voice can have numerous malicious applications, including bypassing biometric identification and using the model for the purpose of impersonation.因此，制定防止潜在滥用的保护措施至关重要：为此，我们已经验证了 SoundStorm 生成的音频仍然可以被专用分类器检测到，该专用分类器使用与我们原始 AudioLM 论文中描述的相同分类器。因此，作为一个更大系统的组件，我们相信 SoundStorm 不太可能给我们之前关于 AudioLM 和 SPEAR-TTS 的论文中讨论的风险带来额外的风险。与此同时，放宽 AudioLM 的内存和计算要求将使音频生成领域的研究更容易被更广泛的社区所接受。未来，我们计划探索其他方法来检测合成语音，例如借助音频水印，以便该技术的任何潜在产品使用都严格遵循我们负责任的人工智能原则。 </p>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;Conclusion</h2>; <p>; We have introduced SoundStorm, a model that can efficiently synthesize high-quality audio from discrete conditioning tokens. When compared to the acoustic generator of <a href="https://ai.googleblog.com/2022/10/audiolm-language-modeling-approach-to.html">;AudioLM</a>;, SoundStorm is two orders of magnitude faster and achieves higher temporal consistency when generating long audio samples. By combining a text-to-semantic token model similar to <a href="https://google-research.github.io/seanet/speartts/examples/">;SPEAR-TTS</a>; with SoundStorm, we can scale text-to-speech synthesis to longer contexts and generate natural dialogues with multiple speaker turns, controlling both the voices of the speakers and the generated content. SoundStorm 不仅限于生成语音。 For example, MusicLM uses SoundStorm to synthesize longer outputs efficiently (<a href="https://ai.googleblog.com/2023/05/google-research-at-io-2023.html">;as seen at I/O</a>;). </p>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;Acknowledgments</h2>; <p>; <em>;The work described here was authored by Zalán Borsos, Matt Sharifi, Damien Vincent, Eugene Kharitonov, Neil Zeghidour and Marco Tagliasacchi. type="text">;Responsible AI at Google Research: AI for Social Good</stitle>;<content type="html">;<span class="byline-author">;Posted by Jimmy Tobin and Katrin Tomanek, Software Engineers, Google Research, AI for Social Good</span>; <p>; Google's <a href="https://ai.google/responsibility/social-good/">;AI for Social Good</a>; team consists of researchers, engineers, volunteers, and others with a shared focus on positive social impact. Our mission is to demonstrate AI's societal benefit by enabling real-world value, with projects spanning work in <a href="https://blog.google/technology/health/making-data-useful-public-health/">;public health</a>;, <a href="https://blog.google/outreach-initiatives/accessibility/making-android-more-accessible/">;accessibility</a>;, <a href="https://sites.research.google/floodforecasting/">;crisis response</a>;, <a href="https://sustainability.google/">;climate and energy,</a>; and <a href="https://blog.google/outreach-initiatives/sustainability/extreme-heat-support/">;nature and society</a>;.我们相信，在服务不足的社区推动积极变革的最佳方式是与变革者及其服务的组织合作。 </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <p>; In this blog post we discuss work done by <a href="https://sites.research.google/euphonia/about/">;Project Euphonia</a>;, a team within <a href="https://ai.google/responsibility/social-good/">;AI for Social Good</a>;, that aims to <a href="https://ai.googleblog.com/2019/08/project-euphonias-personalized-speech.html">;improve automatic speech recognition</a>; (ASR) for people with disordered speech.对于具有典型语音的人来说，ASR 模型的单词错误率 (WER) 可以低于 10%。 But for people with disordered speech patterns, such as stuttering, <a href="https://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/dysarthria/symptoms-causes/syc-20371994">;dysarthria</a>; and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apraxia">;apraxia</a>;, the WER could reach 50% or even 90% depending on the etiology and severity. To help address this problem, we worked with more than 1,000 participants to <a href="https://blog.google/outreach-initiatives/accessibility/project-euphonia-1000-hours-speech-recordings/">;collect over 1,000 hours of disordered speech samples</a>; and used the data to show that ASR <a href="https://ai.googleblog.com/2021/09/personalized-asr-models-from-large-and.html">;personalization</a>; is a viable avenue for bridging the performance gap for users with disordered speech. We've shown that personalization can be successful with as little as <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2110.04612">;3-4 minutes of training speech</a>; using <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/1907.13511">;layer freezing techniques</a>;. </p>; <p>; This work led to the development of <a href="https://sites.research.google/relate/">;Project Relate</a>; for anyone with atypical speech who could benefit from a personalized speech model. Built in partnership with <a href="https://research.google/research-areas/speech-processing/">;Google's Speech team</a>;, Project Relate enables people who find it hard to be understood by other people and technology to train their own models.人们可以使用这些个性化模型来更有效地沟通并获得更多的独立性。 To make ASR more accessible and usable, we describe how we fine-tuned Google's <a href="https://ai.googleblog.com/2023/03/universal-speech-model-usm-state-of-art.html">;Universal Speech Model</a>; (USM) to better understand disordered speech out of the box, without personalization, for use with digital assistant technologies, dictation apps, and in conversations. </p>; <br />; <h2>;Addressing the challenges</h2>; <p>; Working closely with Project Relate users, it became clear that personalized models can be very useful, but for many users, recording dozens or hundreds of examples can be challenging.此外，个性化模型在自由对话中并不总是表现良好。 </p>; <p>; To address these challenges, Euphonia's research efforts have been focusing on <em>;speaker independent</em>; ASR (SI-ASR) to make models work better out of the box for people with disordered speech so that no additional training is necessary. </p>; <br />; <h2>;Prompted Speech dataset for SI-ASR</h2>; <p>; The first step in building a robust SI-ASR model was to create representative dataset splits. We created the Prompted Speech dataset by splitting the <a href="https://www.isca-speech.org/archive/pdfs/interspeech_2021/macdonald21_interspeech.pdf">;Euphonia corpus</a>; into train, validation and test portions, while ensuring that each split spanned a range of speech impairment severity and underlying etiology and that no speakers or phrases appeared in multiple splits.训练部分由 1,000 多个言语紊乱的说话者的超过 950k 条语音组成。该测试集包含来自 350 多个说话者的约 5,700 条话语。言语病理学家手动审查测试集中的所有话语，以确保转录准确性和音频质量。 </p>; <br />; <h2>;Real Conversation test set</h2>; <p>; Unprompted or conversational speech differs from prompted speech in several ways.在谈话中，人们说话速度更快，发音更少。他们重复单词、修复说错的单词，并使用针对他们自己和社区的特定和个人的更广泛的词汇。为了改进此用例的模型，我们创建了真实对话测试集来基准性能。 </p>; <p>; The Real Conversation test set was created with the help of trusted testers who recorded themselves speaking during conversations.音频经过审查，所有个人身份信息 (PII) 都被删除，然后由言语病理学家转录该数据。真实对话测试集包含 29 位说话者的 1,500 多个话语。 </p>; <br />; <h2>;Adapting USM to disordered speech</h2>; <p>; We then tuned USM on the training split of the Euphonia Prompted Speech set to improve its performance on disordered speech. Instead of fine-tuning the full model, our tuning was based on <a href="http://proceedings.mlr.press/v97/houlsby19a/houlsby19a.pdf">;residual adapters</a>;, a parameter-efficient tuning approach that adds tunable bottleneck layers as residuals between the transformer layers.仅调整这些层，而模型权重的其余部分保持不变。 We have <a href="https://aclanthology.org/2021.emnlp-main.541/">;previously shown</a>; that this approach works very well to adapt ASR models to disordered speech. Residual adapters were only added to the encoder layers, and the bottleneck dimension was set to 64. </p>; <br />; <h2>;Results</h2>; <p>; To evaluate the adapted USM, we compared it to older ASR models using the two test sets described above.对于每个测试，我们将改编后的 USM 与最适合该任务的 USM 之前的模型进行比较：（1）对于简短的提示语音，我们与针对简短形式 ASR 优化的 Google 生产 ASR 模型进行比较； (2) for longer Real Conversation speech, we compare to a model <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2005.03271">;trained for long form ASR</a>;. USM improvements over pre-USM models can be explained by USM's relative size increase, 120M to 2B parameters, and other improvements discussed in the <a href="https://ai.googleblog.com/2023/03/universal-speech-model-usm-state-of-art.html">;USM blog post</a>;. </p>; <p>; We see that the USM adapted with disordered speech significantly outperforms the other models.改编后的 USM 在真实对话上的 WER 比 USM 之前的模型好 37%，在提示语音测试集上，改编后的 USM 表现好 53%。 </p>; <p>; These findings suggest that the adapted USM is significantly more usable for an end user with disordered speech.我们可以通过查看由 Euphonia 和 Project Relate 的可信测试人员提供的真实对话测试集录音的记录来证明这一改进（见下文）。 </p>; <p>; A comparison of the Pre-USM and adapted USM transcripts revealed some key advantages: </p>; <ul>;<li>; The first example shows that Adapted USM is better at recognizing disordered speech patterns.基线遗漏了“XBox”和“控制器”等关键词，这些关键词对于听众理解他们想要说的内容非常重要。 </li>; <li>; The second example is a good example of how deletions are a primary issue with ASR models that are not trained with disordered speech.尽管基线模型确实正确转录了一部分，但大部分话语没有被转录，从而丢失了说话者想要传达的信息。 </li>;</ul>; <br />; <h2>;Conclusion</h2>; <p>; We believe that this work is an important step towards making speech recognition more accessible to people with disordered speech.我们正在继续努力提高模型的性能。随着 ASR 的快速发展，我们的目标是确保言语障碍患者也能受益。 </p>; <img src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjuDMQeKcXVKtB_qxFz6L07TTk0j2ApLBEtpsiJa6uaYbztMmcj54TkI7rf3E_v1CJlouSS009__3lA0pALZadBgQTUNiflWqgEFTAg4pu9qF-aPhgxTy5yUayghhd1Yd__fJMMJBIbj6hRIEHZCeiRd9nN5qbs3-zQ_WgAGaXWuQ7OMrR_uY4GU42m1SsH/s320/Non-Abelian%20hero.jpg" style="display: none;" />; <p>; Imagine you're shown two identical objects and then asked to close your eyes.当你睁开眼睛时，你会看到相同位置的两个相同的物体。如何确定它们是否已被来回交换？ Intuition and the laws of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Identical_particles#Quantum_mechanical_description_of_identical_particles">;quantum mechanics agree</a>;: If the objects are truly identical, there is no way to tell. </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <p>; While this sounds like common sense, it only applies to our familiar three-dimensional world. Researchers have predicted that for a special type of particle, called an <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anyon">;anyon</a>;, that is restricted to move only in a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plane_(mathematics)">;two-dimensional</a>; (2D) plane, quantum mechanics allows for something quite different.任意子彼此之间无法区分，并且一些非阿贝尔任意子具有一种特殊属性，该属性会导致交换下的共享量子态存在可观察到的差异，从而可以判断它们何时被交换，尽管它们彼此完全无法区分。虽然研究人员已经成功地检测到它们的亲戚阿贝尔任意子，其交换下的变化更加微妙且不可能直接检测到，但由于控制和检测方面的挑战，实现“非阿贝尔交换行为”被证明更加困难。 </p>; <p>; In “<a href="https://www.nature.com/articles/s41586-023-05954-4">;Non-Abelian braiding of graph vertices in a superconducting processor</a>;”, published in <em>;<a href="https://www.nature.com/">;Nature</a>;</em>;, we report the observation of this non-Abelian exchange behavior for the first time.非阿贝尔任意子可以为量子计算开辟一条新途径，其中量子运算是通过相互交换粒子来实现的，就像字符串相互交换以创建辫子一样。 Realizing this new exchange behavior on our <a href="https://ai.googleblog.com/2019/10/quantum-supremacy-using-programmable.html">;superconducting quantum processor</a>; could be an alternate route to so-called <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/quant-ph/9707021">;topological quantum computation</a>;, which benefits from being robust against environmental noise. </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;Exchange statistics and non-Abelian anyons</h2>; <p>; In order to understand how this strange non-Abelian behavior can occur, it's helpful to consider an analogy with the braiding of two strings.取两根相同的绳子，将它们平行并排放置。交换它们的末端以形成双螺旋形状。字符串是相同的，但由于交换两端时它们会相互缠绕，因此交换两端时非常清晰。 </p>; <p>; The exchange of non-Abelian anyons can be visualized in a similar way, where the strings are made from extending the particles' positions into the time dimension to form “world-lines.”想象一下绘制两个粒子的位置与时间的关系。如果粒子保持原状，绘图将只是两条平行线，代表它们的恒定位置。但如果我们交换粒子的位置，世界线就会相互缠绕。 Exchange them a second time, and you've made a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knot_theory">;knot</a>;. </p>; <p>; While a bit difficult to visualize, knots in four dimensions (three spatial plus one time dimension) can always easily be undone.它们很微不足道——就像鞋带一样，只需拉动一端，它就会散开。但是，当粒子被限制在两个空间维度时，结就处于三个总维度中，并且正如我们从日常 3D 生活中知道的那样，并不总是能轻易解开。非阿贝尔任意子世界线的编织可以用作量子计算操作来改变粒子的状态。 </p>; <p>; A key aspect of non-Abelian anyons is “degeneracy”: the full state of several separated anyons is not completely specified by local information, allowing the same anyon configuration to represent superpositions of several quantum states.非阿贝尔任意子相互缠绕可以改变编码状态。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;How to make a non-Abelian anyon</h2>; <p>; So how do we realize non-Abelian braiding with one of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sycamore_processor">;Google's quantum processors</a>;? We start with the familiar surface code, which we recently used to achieve a <a href="https://ai.googleblog.com/2023/02/suppressing-quantum-errors-by-scaling.html">;milestone in quantum error correction</a>;, where qubits are arranged on the vertices of a checkerboard pattern.棋盘的每个颜色方块代表可以由方块四个角上的量子位进行的两种可能的联合测量之一。 These so-called “stabilizer measurements” can return a value of either + or – 1. The latter is referred to as a plaquette violation, and can be created and moved diagonally — just like bishops in chess — by applying single-qubit <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quantum_logic_gate">;X- and Z-gates</a>;. Recently, we showed that these bishop-like <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2104.01180">;plaquette violations are Abelian anyons</a>;.与非阿贝尔任意子相比，阿贝尔任意子的状态只有在交换时才会发生微妙的变化——变化如此微妙以至于无法直接检测到。虽然阿贝尔任意子很有趣，但它们在拓扑量子计算方面的前景并不像非阿贝尔任意子那样。 </p>; <p>; To produce non-Abelian anyons, we need to control the degeneracy (ie, the number of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wave_function">;wavefunctions</a>; that causes all <a href="https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0003491623000714">;stabilizer</a>; measurements to be +1).由于稳定器测量返回两个可能的值，因此每个稳定器将系统的简并性减半，并且在足够多的稳定器的情况下，只有一个波函数满足标准。因此，增加简并性的一个简单方法是将两个稳定剂合并在一起。在此过程中，我们删除了稳定器网格中的一条边，从而产生只有三个边相交的两个点。 These points, referred to as “<a href="https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0003491623000714">;degree-3 vertices</a>;” (D3Vs), are predicted to be non-Abelian anyons. </p>; <p>; In order to braid the D3Vs, we have to move them, meaning that we have to stretch and squash the stabilizers into new shapes.我们通过在任意子及其邻居之间实现两个量子位门来实现这一点（如下所示的中图和右图）。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEiQ99lWo6CdQ-N48W-wd2x0JV6dHLQ4OVheTvZEkxoYQlbYFarf-QdPajCIDezqKSCDw7y0jkbIxP4ZfzKP6A3I3bCocy7aWfU6ELz2XRDOCF_Kel7wzAwuMieiKhUC4IUAlScBOtuiKBKn8zjeu7UqtDK0oUD6OKpb2Zw3BkUEbxwfHI2-Sm913QYnbQIl/s661/image3.png" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="546" data-original-width="661" height="529" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEiQ99lWo6CdQ-N48W-wd2x0JV6dHLQ4OVheTvZEkxoYQlbYFarf-QdPajCIDezqKSCDw7y0jkbIxP4ZfzKP6A3I3bCocy7aWfU6ELz2XRDOCF_Kel7wzAwuMieiKhUC4IUAlScBOtuiKBKn8zjeu7UqtDK0oUD6OKpb2Zw3BkUEbxwfHI2-Sm913QYnbQIl/w640-h529/image3.png" width="640" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;Non-Abelian anyons in stabilizer codes.<strong>; a:</strong>; Example of a knot made by braiding two anyons' world lines. <strong>;b: </strong>;Single-qubit gates can be used to create and move stabilizers with a value of –1 (red squares).就像国际象棋中的象一样，它们只能沿对角线移动，因此被限制在常规表面代码中的一个子格内。 This constraint is broken when D3Vs (yellow triangles) are introduced.<strong>; c: </strong>;Process to form and move D3Vs (predicted to be non-Abelian anyons). We start with the surface code, where each square corresponds to a joint measurement of the four qubits on its corners (<strong>;left</strong>; panel). We remove an edge separating two neighboring squares, such that there is now a single joint measurement of all six qubits (<strong>;middle</strong>; panel).这会创建两个 D3V，它们是非阿贝尔任意子。我们通过在相邻站点之间应用两个量子位门来移动 D3V（右图）。 </td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <p>; Now that we have a way to create and move the non-Abelian anyons, we need to verify their anyonic behavior. For this we examine three characteristics that would be expected of non-Abelian anyons: </p>; <ol>; <li>;The “<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fusion_of_anyons">;fusion rules</a>;” — What happens when non-Abelian anyons collide with each other? </li>;<li>;Exchange statistics — What happens when they are braided around one another? </li>;<li>;Topological quantum computing primitives — Can we encode qubits in the non-Abelian anyons and use braiding to perform <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quantum_entanglement">;two-qubit entangling operations</a>;? </li>; </ol>; <br />; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;The fusion rules of non-Abelian anyons</h2>; <p>; We investigate fusion rules by studying how a pair of D3Vs interact with the bishop-like plaquette violations introduced above.特别是，我们创建了一对，并通过应用单量子位门将其中一个置于 D3V 周围。 </p>; <p>; While the rules of bishops in chess dictate that the plaquette violations can never meet, the dislocation in the checkerboard lattice allows them to break this rule, meet its partner and annihilate with it.牌匾违规行为现已消失！但是，让非阿贝尔任意子重新相互接触，任意子就会突然变成缺失的斑块破坏。尽管这种行为看起来很奇怪，但它恰恰是我们期望这些实体遵守的融合规则的体现。这建立了 D3V 确实是非阿贝尔任意子的信心。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEhVr2cI-Jm0BIC0VMh6xqp1y57itfmrtbQIlWKDAcXedpOkUaw4I8wenWzibPK56yKrs_eiXeEby86hhxpk-OfAa0zF5De9nQyCKH91CwipepczUmQRQZ8URqP_GdmCposkLXF1_P_AeEoKoHZU9oEN3FDkfxygwvYxICCIVzp8eKheaOV1Vv7CygkKMorp/s982/image4.png" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="826" data-original-width="982" height="538" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEhVr2cI-Jm0BIC0VMh6xqp1y57itfmrtbQIlWKDAcXedpOkUaw4I8wenWzibPK56yKrs_eiXeEby86hhxpk-OfAa0zF5De9nQyCKH91CwipepczUmQRQZ8URqP_GdmCposkLXF1_P_AeEoKoHZU9oEN3FDkfxygwvYxICCIVzp8eKheaOV1Vv7CygkKMorp/w640-h538/image4.png" width="640" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;Demonstration of anyonic fusion rules (starting with <strong>;panel I</strong>;, in the <strong>;lower left</strong>;).我们形成并分离两个 D3V（黄色三角形），然后形成两个相邻的斑块违规（红色方块）并在 D3V 之间传递一个。 D3Vs“棋盘”的变形改变了棋盘违规的主教规则。虽然它们过去位于相邻的方块上，但现在它们能够沿着相同的对角线移动并发生碰撞（如红线所示）。当它们发生碰撞时，它们就会互相消灭。 The D3Vs are brought back together and surprisingly morph into the missing adjacent red plaquette violations.</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <br />; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;Observation of non-Abelian exchange statistics</h2>; <p>; After establishing the fusion rules, we want to see the real smoking gun of non-Abelian anyons: non-Abelian exchange statistics.我们创建两对非阿贝尔任意子，然后通过将每对任意子中的一个相互缠绕来将它们编成辫子（如下所示）。当我们将这两对重新融合在一起时，就会出现两对斑块违规。将任意子相互编织的简单行为改变了我们系统的可观测值。换句话说，如果你在交换非阿贝尔任意子时闭上眼睛，那么当你睁开眼睛时，你仍然能够知道它们已经被交换了。这是非阿贝尔统计的标志。 </p>; The non-Abelian anyons can be used to encode information, represented by <a href="https://ai.googleblog.com/2021/08/demonstrating-fundamentals-of-quantum.html">;logical qubits</a>;, which should be distinguished from the actual <em>;physical</em>; qubits used in the experiment. The number of logical qubits encoded in <em>;N</em>; D3Vs can be shown to be <em>;N</em>;/2–1, so we use <em>;N</em>;=8 D3Vs to encode three logical qubits, and perform braiding to entangle them. By studying the resulting state, we find that the braiding has indeed led to the formation of the desired, well-known quantum entangled state called the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greenberger%E2%80%93Horne%E2%80%93Zeilinger_state">;Greenberger-Horne-Zeilinger</a>; (GHZ) state. </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0"
